thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 14 May 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: JPMorgan submits application for majority-owned China securities business

author: Reuters Editorial
title: JPMorgan submits application for majority-owned China securities business
text:
HONG KONG, May 14 (Reuters) - JPMorgan Chase & Co said on Monday it had submitted an application to the Chinese securities regulator for setting up a new onshore securities business in which the U.S. bank would own a 51 percent stake.
The bank’s asset and wealth management unit is also working on increasing its current joint venture stake to a majority interest, subject to an agreement with its joint venture partner and the relevant authorities, it said in a statement.
JPMorgan also said it had appointed Mark Leung as the chief executive of its China business.
The submission of the application to the regulator marks a step towards JPMorgan’s return to China securities business after 2016 when it sold its 33 percent holding in a similar venture to its local partner. (Reporting by Sumeet Chatterjee; Editing by Himani Sarkar)
